thread.title: ​How This Man Lost More Than 200 Pounds and Opened His Own Gym | Men’s Health
thread.title_full: ​How This Man Lost More Than 200 Pounds and Opened His Own Gym | Men’s Health

title: ​How This Man Lost More Than 200 Pounds and Opened His Own Gym | Men’s Health
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
So for the next 3 years, Gianndrea committed himself to daily movement. He started exercising every day and transformed his diet by cutting out fast food and loading his plate with protein , fiber , and lots of fruit. In 15 months, he lost 225 pounds and has focused on building muscle ever since—no surgery, no magic pills, just hard work. 
“It’s a mental battle. It’s more mental than it is physical,” Gianndrea told ABC 30 . “Losing the weight was hard but keeping it off and reminding yourself why you’re doing it, it’s all mental.” A post shared by True Grit, LLC. (@biggieodonnell) on Jan 13, 2017 at 6:30am PST 
That motivation didn’t stop with his own journey, because he now spends his days training and inspiring others in his own personal gym. The best part? Business is booming. 
“Helping those who stand at the starting line I once stood at makes this all more the worth while to me,” Gianndrea wrote on his website. “To help, to inspire, and to be a part of people’s journey and see them find their smile and self worth has been worth every tear I’ve cried, every bead of sweat I’ve dropped, and all the pain I’ve endured.”
